intro: Diaphananthe candida, commonly known as the white-flowered diaphananthe, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate or elliptical, with a smooth texture and a glossy appearance. Diaphananthe candida is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats.
